([[Vejen]], July 26, 1975)| World cup apps = 1 | World cup first = 1978 | World cup best = Winners, [[FIFA Women's World Cup 1978|1978]] | Olympic apps = | Olympic first = -| Olympic best = -| Regional name = [[UEFA Women's Championship]] | Regional cup apps = 9 | Regional cup first = [[1984 UEFA Women's Championship|1984]]| Regional cup best = Semi-finals ([[2005 UEFA Women's Championship|2005]]) |type=women }} The '''Finland women's national football team''' represents [[Finland]] in international [[Women's association football|women's football]]. The team, controlled by the [[Football Association of Finland]] (SPL/FBF), reached the semi-finals of the [[2005 UEFA Women's Championship|2005 European Championship]], surprising the female football world having drawn with [[Sweden]] and beaten [[Denmark]]. Finland hosted the [[2009 UEFA Women's Championship|2009 EC finals]]. The Finnish team now has a few players that are considered to be among the best in the female football, such as [[Laura Ãsterberg Kalmari]], [[Sanna Valkonen]] and [[Anne MÃ¤kinen]]. == Honours ==
